Name: Bronze figure of Bastet
Description: Small bronze figurine of the goddess Bastet as a cat-headed woman, wearing a long dress and holding up an aegis, an amulet in the form of a god's head with wide floral necklace. Such figures were produced in large numbers from the Late Period to the Roman Period. The cult centre of Bast, originally goddess of protective ointment, lay at Bubastis in the Delta, but images of her are found throughout Egypt after the tenth century BC.
